required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Post-Marketing Surveillance of Micombi Tablets Survey on the Long-term Use
clinical_study.official_title: Post Marketing Surveillance on Long Drug Use of Micombi Combination Tablets in Patients With Hypertension

brief_summary.textblock: The survey is conducted to collect safety and effectiveness information in Hypertensive patients treated with Micombi Tablets on the long term use in daily clinical settings in Japan.

primary_outcome.description: The number of patient with any AEs, patients with drug-related AEs

secondary_outcome.description: SBP is observed at Week 0 and Week 52. The change of SBP from Week 0 to Week 52 is calculated.
DBP is observed at Week 0 and Week 52. The change of DBP from Week 0 to Week 52 is calculated.

The proportion of the patients with target blood pressure in 52 weeks administrative period. Target blood pressure is defined as 'Guidelines for the management of hypertension (JSH2009)': less than 140/90 (SBP/DBP) mmHg for >= 65 years old or cerebrovascular disorder patient; less than 130/80 in diabetes, chronic kidney disease or myocardial infarction patient; less than 130/85 mmHg for others patient.
The proportion of the patients with normalized blood pressure in 52 weeks on administrative period. Normalized blood pressure is defined less than 140/90 (SBP/DBP) mmHg according to JSH2009

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
Hypertensive patients who have never taken Micombi Tablets.
Exclusion criteria:

participant_flow.recruitment_details: A total of 1452 patients were enrolled. Of these patients, the CRFs of 9 patients were uncollected by reason of institution, and the 18 patients which were no information including safety due to no visit after enrolled. Then, total 1425 patients were observed in the survey.

group.title: Combination Tablet AP
group.description: Fix dose combination tablets of telmisartan 40mg and hydrochlorothiazide 12.5mg

group.title: Combination Tablet BP
group.description: Fix dose combination tablets of telmisartan 80mg and hydrochlorothiazide 12.5mg

baseline.population: The 18 patients which had no information including safety due to no visit after enrolled, were excluded from the safety analysis, 1,425 patients were included in the safety set.

group.title: Combination Tablet AP
group.description: Fix dose combination tablets of telmisartan 40mg and hydrochlorothiazide 12.5mg

group.description: Fix dose combination tablets of telmisartan 80mg and hydrochlorothiazide 12.5mg

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Incidence of Adverse Events (AEs)
outcome.description: The number of patient with any AEs, patients with drug-related AEs
outcome.population: The all treated patients, 18 patients which were no information including safety due to no visit after enrolled. Then, total 1425 patients were observed in the survey

group.description: Fix dose combination tablets of telmisartan 40mg and hydrochlorothiazide 12.5mg

group.description: Fix dose combination tablets of telmisartan 80mg and hydrochlorothiazide 12.5mg

group.title: Total
group.description: Fix dose combination tablets of telmisartan 40/80mg and hydrochlorothiazide 12.5mg

measure.title: Incidence of Adverse Events (AEs)
measure.description: The number of patient with any AEs, patients with drug-related AEs
measure.population: The all treated patients, 18 patients which were no information including safety due to no visit after enrolled. Then, total 1425 patients were observed in the survey

outcome.title: Systolic Blood Pressure (SBP)
outcome.description: SBP is observed at Week 0 and Week 52. The change of SBP from Week 0 to Week 52 is calculated.
outcome.population: The 13 patients which no efficacy information, were excluding from safety set, 1412 patients were included in efficacy set.

outcome.title: Target Blood Pressure Achievement Rate
outcome.description: The proportion of the patients with target blood pressure in 52 weeks administrative period. Target blood pressure is defined as 'Guidelines for the management of hypertension (JSH2009)': less than 140/90 (SBP/DBP) mmHg for >= 65 years old or cerebrovascular disorder patient; less than 130/80 in diabetes, chronic kidney disease or myocardial infarction patient; less than 130/85 mmHg for others patient.
outcome.population: The 13 patients which no efficacy information, were excluding from safety set, 1412 patients were included in efficacy set.

measure.description: The proportion of the patients with target blood pressure in 52 weeks administrative period. Target blood pressure is defined as 'Guidelines for the management of hypertension (JSH2009)': less than 140/90 (SBP/DBP) mmHg for >= 65 years old or cerebrovascular disorder patient; less than 130/80 in diabetes, chronic kidney disease or myocardial infarction patient; less than 130/85 mmHg for others patient.
measure.population: The 13 patients which no efficacy information, were excluding from safety set, 1412 patients were included in efficacy set.

outcome.title: Blood Pressure Normalised Rate
outcome.description: The proportion of the patients with normalized blood pressure in 52 weeks on administrative period. Normalized blood pressure is defined less than 140/90 (SBP/DBP) mmHg according to JSH2009
outcome.population: The 13 patients which no efficacy information, were excluding from safety set, 1412 patients were included in efficacy set.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
